trans-unit.source: Represents a right granted to a user to access information in a rights managed document.
As with other <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement> types, <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant> is only usable in full trust applications.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant"></xref> class that grants a specified <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> a specified <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentRight"></xref>.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant> instance with no date or time limitations.
The <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to <xref:System.DateTime>.<xref:System.DateTime.MinValue> which indicates there is no starting limitation.
The <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.ValidUntil%2A> property is set to <xref:System.DateTime>.<xref:System.DateTime.MaxValue> which indicates there is no ending limitation.
Use the alternate <xref:System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create an instance with date and time limitations.
The user the access right is granted to.
The access right that is granted.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant"></xref> class that grants a specified <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser"></xref> a specified <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentRight"></xref> for a specified <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> duration.
Specify the `validFrom` parameter with <xref:System.DateTime>.<xref:System.DateTime.MinValue> if there is no start date and time limitation.
Specify the `validUntil` parameter with <xref:System.DateTime>.<xref:System.DateTime.MaxValue> if there is no end date and time limitation.
The user the access right is granted to.
The access right that is granted.
The starting date and time that the right begins.
The ending date and time that the right expires.
Gets the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentRight"></xref> that is granted.

The access right that is granted to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.User"></xref>, as specified to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.#ctor(System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser,System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentRight)"></xref> constructor.
Gets the user who is granted the access <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.Right"></xref>.

The user that the access <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.Right"></xref> is granted to, as specified to the <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.#ctor(System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentUser,System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentRight)"></xref> constructor.
Gets the starting date and time that the granted <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.Right"></xref> begins.

The start date and time that the granted <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.Right"></xref> begins, or <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref>.<xref href="System.DateTime.MinValue"></xref>
if there is there is no starting limitation.
Gets the ending date and time that the granted <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.Right"></xref> expires.

The end date and time that the granted <xref href="System.Security.RightsManagement.ContentGrant.Right"></xref> expires, or <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref>.<xref href="System.DateTime.MaxValue"></xref>
if there is no ending limitation.
